main event: Captain Harold M. Holloway observed an unidentified flying object at Greater Pittsburgh Airport on December 4, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as pale gold and was 3-5 feet in diameter,The sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds,The local GCA station and airport control tower had no knowledge of the sighting,The object was observed at a speed of 200-300 knots,The sighting was considered a qualified technical observation.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object with a pale gold glow
